Report and
Recommendations

A comprehensive analysis and actionable insights based on your microbiome

Discover the unique nature of your microbiome

We provide information about the specific types and ratios of bacteria present in your microbiome, as well as any variations or unusual characteristics that may be present. It may also include information about how your microbiome compares to the average microbiome, and any factors that may have contributed to its unique makeup.

By understanding the unique nature of your microbiome, you can gain insights into your overall health and wellness, and potentially identify any imbalances or issues that may need to be addressed.

Explore how your gut bacteria affect your food choices

We provide information on how bacteria present in your microbiome may influence your appetite and food choices, as well as information about any imbalances or abnormalities in your microbiome that may be impacting your eating behaviors and recommendations for how to address these issues.

By understanding the effects of your intestinal bacteria on your food intake, you can gain insights into your overall health and wellness, and potentially make changes to your diet and lifestyle to support a healthy microbiome.

Determine the health conditions associated to your gut bacteria

We provide information about how the bacteria present in your microbiome may be associated with different health conditions. For example, certain types of bacteria may be linked to an increased risk of certain diseases or conditions, such as obesity, diabetes, or inflammatory bowel disease. On the other hand, other types of bacteria may be protective against these conditions.

By understanding the health conditions that your bacteria can be associated with, you can gain insights into your overall health and wellness, and potentially identify any potential risks or concerns that may need to be addressed.

Learn More

How do my diet and lifestyle affect my microbiome?

Your diet and lifestyle play a major role in shaping the composition and function of your microbiome.

A diet high in processed foods, sugar, and saturated fats can lead to an imbalance in the types of bacteria in your gut, with less beneficial bacteria and more harmful bacteria. This can lead to an overgrowth of pro-inflammatory bacteria, which can contribute to the development of chronic diseases such as obesity, type 2 diabetes, and inflammatory bowel disease.

I'VE RECENTLY TAKEN ANTIBIOTICS, HOW DOES THAT AFFECT MY MICROBIOME?

Sometimes, antibiotics are prescribed to change the composition of the microbiome, specially when treating bacterial infections, but these can have a negative impact on the gut microbiome by killing off beneficial bacteria as well.

Taking antibiotics can lead to an overgrowth of harmful bacteria and an imbalance in the types of bacteria present in the gut. It’s important to follow the doctors’ instructions for the recommended duration of the antibiotic treatment.

Can my microbiome be changed, and if so, how?

Yes, your microbiome can be changed, and there are two main ways in which this can be achieved.

The first one is diet, which has a direct impact on the types and ratios of bacteria present in your gut, and small changes to your diet can have a big impact on the makeup of your microbiome, reducing your intake of processed foods, sugar, and saturated fats can help to reduce harmful bacteria.

The second way is probiotics, which are live microorganisms that are similar to the beneficial microorganisms that are already present in your gut. They can help to promote the growth of beneficial bacteria and maintain a healthy balance of microorganisms in your gut.

To cover these two main catalysts for microbiome restructure, we offer dietary recommendations and personalized probiotics, based on your individual microbiome.

Other factors like stress, sleep, and exercise can also affect the gut microbiome. Additionally, changes in the microbiome can take some time to happen and it may require a consistent effort to maintain the desired changes.
